info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 9 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS New Orleans LA
info.description:
At 800 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms capable of producing funnel clouds along a line extending from near Perkinston to near Picayune. Movement was east at 35 mph.
HAZARD...Funnel clouds, wind gusts up to 50 mph, and half inch hail.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...If a funnel cloud briefly touches down, minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects.
Locations impacted include... Gulfport, Biloxi, Long Beach, Picayune, Diamondhead, Saucier, Kiln, Lyman, Latimer, and Gulfport Airport.
This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Mississippi between mile markers 14 and 43. Interstate 59 in Mississippi between mile markers 1 and 14.
info.instruction:
If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. This type of funnel cloud is harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors or to safe harbor and report your sighting to the National Weather Service.
These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

parameter.value: STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF HARRISON, NORTHERN HANCOCK, NORTHWESTERN JACKSON AND SOUTHERN PEARL RIVER COUNTIES THROUGH 845 PM CDT

area.areaDesc: Pearl River; Northern Hancock; Northern Harrison; Northern Jackson; Southern Hancock; Southern Harrison
